verses.verse: A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> and Song <S%H7892><s%> at the dedication <S%H2598><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> I will extol <S%H7311><s%> you, O LORD; <S%H3068><s%> for you have lifted <S%H1802><s%> me up, and have not made my foes <S%H341><s%> to rejoice <S%H8055><s%> over me.
O LORD <S%H3068><s%> my God, <S%H430><s%> I cried <S%H7768><s%> to you, and you have healed <S%H7495><s%> me.

O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> you have brought <S%H5927><s%> up my soul <S%H5315><s%> from the grave: <S%H7585><s%> you have kept me alive, <S%H2421><s%> that I should not go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the pit. <S%H953><s%>
Sing <S%H2167><s%> to the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> O you saints <S%H2623><s%> of his, and give thanks <S%H3034><s%> at the remembrance <S%H2143><s%> of his holiness. <S%H6944><s%>

For his anger <S%H639><s%> endures but a moment; <S%H7281><s%> in his favor <S%H7522><s%> is life: <S%H2416><s%> weeping <S%H1065><s%> may endure <S%H3885><s%> for a night, <S%H6153><s%> but joy <S%H7440><s%> comes in the morning. <S%H1242><s%>
And in my prosperity <S%H7961><s%> I said, <S%H559><s%> I shall never <S%H3808><s%> <S%H5769><s%> be moved. <S%H4131><s%>

LORD, <S%H3068><s%> by your favor <S%H7522><s%> you have made my mountain <S%H2042><s%> to stand <S%H5975><s%> strong: <S%H5797><s%> you did hide <S%H5641><s%> your face, <S%H6440><s%> and I was troubled. <S%H926><s%>
I cried <S%H7121><s%> to you, O LORD; <S%H3068><s%> and to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> I made supplication. <S%H2603><s%>

What <S%H4100><s%> profit <S%H1215><s%> is there in my blood, <S%H1818><s%> when I go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the pit? <S%H7845><s%> Shall the dust <S%H6083><s%> praise <S%H3034><s%> you? shall it declare <S%H5046><s%> your truth? <S%H571><s%>
Hear, <S%H8085><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and have mercy <S%H2603><s%> on me: LORD, <S%H3068><s%> be you my helper. <S%H5826><s%>

You have turned <S%H2015><s%> for me my mourning <S%H4553><s%> into dancing: <S%H4234><s%> you have put <S%H6605><s%> off my sackcloth, <S%H8242><s%> and girded <S%H247><s%> me with gladness; <S%H8057><s%>

To the end <S%H4616><s%> that my glory <S%H3519><s%> may sing <S%H2167><s%> praise to you, and not be silent. <S%H1826><s%> O LORD <S%H3068><s%> my God, <S%H430><s%> I will give thanks <S%H3034><s%> to you for ever. <S%H5769><s%>
